thread.title: Rangana Herath's 10-wicket match haul hands Sri Lanka victory over West Indies
thread.title_full: Rangana Herath's 10-wicket match haul hands Sri Lanka victory over West Indies

title: Rangana Herath's 10-wicket match haul hands Sri Lanka victory over West Indies
text:
Rangana Herath's 10-wicket match haul hands Sri Lanka victory over West Indies 17 Oct 2015 13:01:52 
comments 
Rangana Herath span Sri Lanka to an innings-and-six-run success over the West Indies in Galle with the fifth 10-wicket match haul of his career. 
The 37-year-old's six for 68 first time around helped restrict the tourists to 251 and after the follow on was enforced on Friday, Herath claimed four for 79 as the Windies were skittled out for 227, their cumulative efforts just short of Sri Lanka's first-innings 484. 
Such a comprehensive defeat looked unlikely while Jermaine Blackwood was at the crease but he was the last man out eight shy of three figures as Sri Lanka drew first blood in the two-Test series. 
West Indies began the day on 67 for two, still 167 runs short of making Sri Lanka bat again, and with nightwatchman Devendra Bishoo in the middle. 
Only seven runs had been added to the total when he succumbed to Herath on 10 as an attempted cut shot picked out Sri Lanka captain Angelo Mathews, and from the very next ball Marlon Samuels was pinned in his crease offering no shot to the left armer. 
Blackwood survived Herath's hat-trick delivery and quickly found his rhythm, but the West Indies were soon five down for 88, Darren Bravo exiting for 31 when nicking a fullish delivery from Nuwan Pradeep behind. 
New batsman Denesh Ramdin and Blackwood steadied the ship by marshalling the visitors past 100 and they had accrued 48 before the former, on 11, mistimed a drive off Milinda Siriwardana that was held at second slip by Kaushal Silva. 
Blackwood survived a chance that was shelled behind with him on 41 and entered lunch on 49 before bringing up his half-century in the first over of the second session. 
However, Jason Holder's support act finished for 18 after he was run out by Mathews having been caught down the pitch attempting a leg-side swipe to Herath. 
Sri Lanka sensed victory when three wickets fell for 17 runs - Kemar Roach stumped off Herath and Jerome Taylor removed leg-before by Dhammika Prasad, both for five - yet Blackwood hogged the strike during the last-wicket stand and went on the offensive, smashing a pair of maximums en route to making 25 off successive Herath overs. 
He failed to make only his second Test ton, though, holing out to Silva off Prasad as the home side sealed a big victory inside four days. Related Sport News
